intro: Amyema scoparia, commonly known as the narrow-leafed amyema, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It belongs to the family Myrtaceae, which includes eucalyptus and other aromatic plants. The plant is characterized by its narrow, lance-shaped leaves and small, white or pale pink flowers that appear in clusters. It typically grows in sandy or rocky soils and is often found in open woodlands or shrublands. Amyema scoparia is well adapted to arid and semi-arid environments, showing resilience to drought and poor soil conditions.
